intro: Senecio albonervius, commonly known as the white-veined groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features narrow, linear leaves with distinctive white veins, and it produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a composite head. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, composite flower structure. Senecio albonervius is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ornamental appeal.
